qas.question: When was the Niger Delta Nembe Creek Oil field found?
What is the depth of the Niger Delta Nembe Creek Oil field?
What type of geology is the Niger Delta Nembe Creek Oil field?

answers.text: middle Miocene deltaic sandstone-shale in an anticline structural trap

qas.question: How long have international oil companies been in Nigeria?

context: The Niger Delta Nembe Creek Oil field was discovered in <a0_0>1973<a0_0/> and produces from <a2_0>middle Miocene deltaic sandstone-shale in an anticline structural trap<a2_0/> at a depth of <a1_0>2–4 km<a1_0/>. In June 2013, the company announced a strategic review of its operations in Nigeria, hinting that assets could be divested. While many international oil companies have operated there for <a3_0>decades<a3_0/>, by 2014 most were making moves to divest their interests, citing a range of issues including oil theft. In August 2014, Shell Oil Company said it was finalising its interests in four Nigerian oil fields.
